word.textCn: 参观者, 游客, 来访者

sentence.text: I live in a very old town which is surrounded by beautiful woods.
sentence.textCn: 我住在一个由美丽的树林环绕的古老小镇上。

sentence.text: It is a famous beauty spot.
sentence.textCn: 这是一个著名的风景胜地。

sentence.text: On Sundays, hundreds of people come from the city to see our town and to walk through the woods.
sentence.textCn: 每逢星期天，有许许多多人从城里来观赏我们的小镇，并在树林中散步。

sentence.text: Visitors have been asked to keep the woods clean and tidy.
sentence.textCn: 游客已被告知要保持树林的整洁。

sentence.text: Litter baskets have been placed under the trees, but people still throw their rubbish everywhere.
sentence.textCn: 树下都已设置了废物筐，但是人们仍到处扔垃圾。

sentence.text: Last Wednesday, I went for a walk in the woods.
sentence.textCn: 上星期三我到树林里去散步。

sentence.text: What I saw made me very sad.
sentence.textCn: 我所见到的一切使我非常难过。

sentence.text: I counted seven old cars and three old refrigerators.
sentence.textCn: 我数了一下，有7辆旧汽车和3个旧冰箱。

sentence.text: The litter baskets were empty and the ground was covered with pieces of paper, cigarette ends, old tyres, empty bottles and rusty tins.
sentence.textCn: 废物筐是空的，而满地都是纸片、烟头、旧轮胎、空瓶子和生锈的空罐头盒。

sentence.text: Among the rubbish, I found a sign which said, 'Anyone who leaves litter in these woods will be prosecuted !'
sentence.textCn: 在垃圾堆中我发现了一块牌子，上面写着：“凡在此树林里丢弃垃圾者，将依法处置。”
